Blueberries and Breast Cancer

Summary generated using: $shovel3 query.concatConclusions 'breast cancer blueberries site:ncbi.nlm.nih.gov' 40 includeReference=True

Pterostilbene effectively suppresses the generation of CSCs and metastatic potential under the influence of M2 TAMs via modulating EMT associated signaling pathways, specifically NF-κB/miR488 circuit. Thus, pterostilbene could be an ideal anti-CSC agent in clinical settings.© 2013 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.Citation: Journal:Molecular Nutrition & Food Research, Date:06/30/13

Pterostilbene shows an additive inhibitory effect on breast cancer cells when combined with tamoxifen, most likely from augmented cancer cell apoptosis.Copyright © 2010 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.Citation: Journal:None, Date:None
